author: pinkpanzer101
text:
The problem is that you're saying God is loving, God is moral, etc, and yet when anyone tries to apply even a very loose definition, God doesn't fit. Even applying the Bible's *own* definition of love, God doesn't fit:

1 Corinthians 13:4-7: "Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres."

Patient? Certainly not - take the story of the golden calf, for example, where Moses comes down from the mountain with the tablets, God sees the golden calf, his immediate reaction to them having broken a rule *he hadn't even given them yet* is to have 3,000 of them slaughtered.

God is also jealous - Exodus says his very name is jealous.

Keeps no record of wrongs? Well that's not true right from the start to the end.

God is described as avenging and wrathful, not exactly the pinnacle of kindness.

Always protects? On numerous occasions God removes his protection from some group or person he liked before because they did something he didn't like. (The golden calf is again such an example).

Always perseveres? Well God basically gave up early on in Genesis and decided to flood the world and reset everything. That's not persevering, that's erasing everything and starting again.

So not only does God not match any definitions in common usage, but he also doesn't match the definition *the Bible itself gives*.

(Also you can't make a circle out of Bezier curves; and before I had been more specific in saying right angles, I just wasn't bothered to type it out again to make the same point)
